entry.title: Armenian law enforcement raids fringe group after police station attack

media:group.media:title: Armenian law enforcement raids fringe group after police station attack
media:group.media:description:
๐ Armenian police found additional weapons in raids at homes of members and the offices of a fringe group that may be connected to a police station attack over the weekend. ๐ A Russian government spokesperson called on Armenia to show โpolitical will to continue developing relationsโ as ties between the two countries continue to fray. ๐ Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan called on Turkey to implement a preliminary agreement reached two years ago to partially reopen its long-closed border with Armenia.

entry.title: Laurence Broers: Sustainable peace is โbeyond the high table and a piece of paperโ

media:group.media:title: Laurence Broers: Sustainable peace is โbeyond the high table and a piece of paperโ
media:group.media:description:
Laurence Broers, associate fellow at Chatham Houseโs Russia and Eurasia Programme, sits down with CivilNetโs Karen Harutyunyan to speak about the developments in the region since the 2020 Nagorno-Karabakh war. Laurence discusses regional geopolitics, Western mediation efforts, the bilateral negotiation track, and Russiaโs role. Even weakened, Russia will remain a tremendously powerful player in the South Caucasus, Laurence says.
Earlier last week, Laurence delivered a speech at a conference in Yerevan titled โThe South Caucasus: Trends and prospects in the context of the war in Ukraine,โ organized by the Caucasus Institute.
0:00 Why did Russia fail to enforce the full implementation of the November 9 agreement? 5:13 How could the situation over Karabakh have evolved if Armenia and Azerbaijan had kept to the deal? 9:57 Russiaโs invasion of Ukraine and Azerbaijanโs new opportunities for coercive diplomacy. 12:07 โPutin wants to punish Pashinyanโ 14:32 Can the West and Russia compartmentalize the Armenia-Azerbaijan conflict? 22:22 Armenia and Azerbaijan are in post-mediation phase. 27:00 Why couldnโt the West prevent ethnic cleansing in Karabakh? 31:28 What could happen in the Caucasus if Russia wins the war in Ukraine?

ินีธึึึีซีกีถ ิตึึีกีถีซ ีธึ ิฒีกึีพีซ ีดีซีปึ ีฐีกีฏีกีดีกึีฟีธึีฉีตีธึีถีธึีด ีกีถีฏีธีฒีดีถีกีฏีกีฌ ีนีง ึ ีกีปีกีฏึีธึีด ีง ิฑีคึีขีฅีปีกีถีซีถี ีฅีฌีถีฅีฌีธีพ ีบึีกีฃีดีกีฟีซีฏ ีฐีกีทีพีกึีฏีถีฅึีซึ, ีกีฝีธึีด ีง ินีธึึึีซีกีตีซ ีีกีคีซึ ีีกีฝ ีฐีกีดีกีฌีฝีกึีกีถีซ ีดีซีปีกีฆีฃีกีตีซีถ ีฐีกึีกีขีฅึีธึีฉีตีธึีถีถีฅึีซ ีบึีธึีฅีฝีธึ ีีธึีฝีฟีกึีก ิฑีตีคีจีถีจ ีีซีพีซีฌีีฅีฉีซ ิณีฅีธึีฃีซ ีีซึีฆีกีขีฅีฏีตีกีถีซ ีฐีฅีฟ ีฆึีธึีตึีธึีดึ ีีก ีถีฏีกีฟีธึีด ีง, ีธึ ีฟีกึีกีฎีกีทึีปีกีถีธึีด ินีธึึึีซีกีตีซ ีกีผีกีพีฅีฌ ีกีฆีคีฅึีซีฏีธึีฉีตีกีถ ีฐีกีดีกึ ีบีฅีฟึ ีง ีกีพีฅีฌีซ ีดีธีฟ ีฏีกีบีฅึ ีธึีถีฅีถีกีฌ ีีกีตีกีฝีฟีกีถีซ ีธึ ีึีกีฝีฟีกีถีซ ีฐีฅีฟึ ิฑีตีคีจีถีจ ีฐีกีถีฃีกีดีกีถีกีฌีซึ ีบีกึีฆีกีขีกีถีธึีด ีง ีีกึีกีพีกีตีซีถ ิฟีธีพีฏีกีฝีธึีด ีธึีชีฅึีซ ีคีกีฝีกีพีธึีธึีฉีตีธึีถีถ ีธึ ีดีฅีฎ ีญีกีฒีกึีธีฒีถีฅึีซ ีทีกีฐีฅึีซ ีฐีกีดีจีถีฏีถีธึีดีถ ีธึ ีฐีกีฏีกีคึีธึีฉีตีธึีถีจึ ินีธึึึ ีบึีธึีฅีฝีธึีจ ีีกีตีกีฝีฟีกีถีธึีด ีงึี ีดีกีฝีถีกีฏึีฅีฌีธึ ยซีีกึีกีพีกีตีซีถ ิฟีธีพีฏีกีฝโค ีดีซีฟีธึีดีถีฅึีถ ีธึ ีฐีฅีผีกีถีฏีกึีถีฅึีจ ีธึีฏึีกีซีถีกีฏีกีถ ีบีกีฟีฅึีกีฆีดีซ ีฐีกีดีกีฟีฅึีฝีฟีธึีดยป ีฏีธีถึีฅึีกีถีฝีซีถึ
Turkey is not impartial in the conflict between Armenia and Azerbaijan and supports Azerbaijan based on pragmatic calculations, according to Mustafa Aydin, professor of international relations at Turkey's Kadir Has University. Sitting down with CivilNetโs Georgi Mirzabekyan, Aydin notes that, for Turkey to be more influential in the region, it needs to have closer ties with Armenia and Georgia. This helps explain the arrangement of powers in the South Caucasus and the convergence and divergence of major powersโ interests here. The Turkish professor was in Yerevan to participate in the โThe South Caucasus: Trends and prospects in the context of the war in Ukraineโ conference.

media:group.media:description:
A quatre heure de route dโErevan, se trouve la ville de Goris. La citรฉ, nichรฉe dans la province du Syunik prรจs de la frontiรจre avec l'Azerbaรฏdjan, accueille le seul centre de rรฉhabilitation de la rรฉgion. Les adultes qui frappent ร la porte du centre sont des personnes victimes dโaccident vasculaires cรฉrรฉbrales, de problรจmes articulaires et neuro-orthopรฉdiques. Faute dโexperts, le centre prend aussi en charge les enfants atteints de lourds handicaps.

entry.title: Tavush border village residents want their lands back from Azerbaijan

media:group.media:title: Tavush border village residents want their lands back from Azerbaijan
media:group.media:description:
Four years after the military clashes in the Tavush-Tovuz region of the Armenian-Azerbaijani border, there are renewed concerns in the northeastern part of Armenia regarding potential aggression from Azerbaijan. As efforts to reach a normalization deal continue to stall, Baku has demanded that Yerevan relinquish control of four out of eight villages, which were previously inhabited by Azerbaijanis but are located within the Republic of Armenia. Meanwhile, Armeniaโs demands for the return of segments of lands belonging to 31 villages continue to be ignored.
